newsitem.title: INDIA: India December sugar output falls sharply.
newsitem.headline: India December sugar output falls sharply.

text.p: India produced 2.22 million tonnes of sugar in December 1996, down from 2.38 million a year earlier, the sugar industry said on Monday.

The National Federation of Cooperative Sugar Factories and the Indian Sugar Mills Association said in a joint statement that the country produced 2.98 million tonnes of sugar in the first three months of the 1996/97 (October-September) season, sharply lower than the 3.75 million produced a year earlier.
The statement said as on December 31, 1996 India held 7.17 million tonnes of sugar stocks, against 5.80 million a year earlier.
